title.narrative: 3.1 CHILDREN WELL-BEING AND DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: Equitable access to quality Health, Nutrition, HIV and AIDS ,and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services for children, adolsecvents, youth and women reinforced,, which contributes to Child Health, Health Systems Strengthening, Nutrition And Emergencies, Sanitation, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Wash â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved equitable access to/utilization of high-quality promotional/preventive/curative/rehabilitative Health, HIV/AIDS, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH), Nutrition services for children adolescents, youth, women

sector.narrative: Capacity building for nutrition preparedness and response
HSS - Health sector policy, planning and governance at national or sub-national levels
HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Immunization supply chain, including cold chain
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration
